title: Admission & Career Coaching
subtitle: Practical guidance to choose the right academic stream, prepare for higher studies, and explore global opportunities

streams.name: Science Stream
streams.description: Explore Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and Mathematics to build a strong foundation for careers in healthcare, engineering, biotechnology, research, and emerging technologies.
requirements: High school diploma with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics/Biology
Qualify national entrance exams (JEE for engineering / NEET for medicine)

streams.name: Commerce Stream
streams.description: Learn Accounting, Economics, and Business Studies to prepare for careers in finance, entrepreneurship, corporate law, and global business management.
requirements: High school diploma with commerce or mathematics subjects
Interest in business, economics, and finance

streams.name: Arts & Humanities
streams.description: Dive into Literature, History, Psychology, Sociology, and Fine Arts ‚Äî fostering creativity, critical thinking, cultural understanding, and social awareness.
requirements: Interest in culture, society, and human behavior

streams.name: Technical/Vocational
streams.description: Hands-on training in Engineering, IT, Design, and Skilled Trades designed to prepare you for immediate job opportunities, industry certifications, and entrepreneurship.
requirements: Technical aptitude and interest in applied learning

studyAbroadSteps.title: Research & Planning
studyAbroadSteps.description: Explore top-ranked universities, admission deadlines, and available scholarships to choose your ideal study destination.
details: Research university rankings and program reputation
Check admission deadlines and entry requirements
Compare tuition costs, living expenses, and scholarship options

studyAbroadSteps.title: Language Proficiency
studyAbroadSteps.description: Prepare for IELTS, TOEFL, or PTE with practice tests and coaching to meet admission requirements.
details: Take mock tests or preparation courses
Achieve the minimum required score for your chosen university

studyAbroadSteps.title: Application Process
studyAbroadSteps.description: Submit well-prepared applications to universities, ensuring all documents and essays are complete.
details: Write strong personal statements or essays

studyAbroadSteps.title: Financial Planning
studyAbroadSteps.description: Plan your education funding with scholarships, part-time work, and student loans.
details: Apply for government and university scholarships
Arrange education loans or sponsorships if needed

studyAbroadSteps.title: Visa Application
studyAbroadSteps.description: Secure your student visa by preparing documents, attending interviews, and paying application fees on time.
details: Collect required financial and admission documents
Schedule and attend your visa interview
Pay visa application and service fees promptly

countries.name: United States
countries.popular: MIT, Harvard, Stanford ‚Äî global leaders in research and innovation.
countries.info: The US has over 4,000 universities with world-class programs. Known for innovation, cultural diversity, and post-graduation job opportunities.

countries.name: United Kingdom
countries.popular: Oxford, Cambridge, Imperial ‚Äî rich academic tradition and globally recognized degrees.
countries.info: The UK offers globally respected degrees, shorter course durations, and access to Europe. Ideal for students seeking academic prestige.

countries.name: Canada
countries.popular: Toronto, UBC, McGill ‚Äî affordable education with post-study work opportunities.
countries.info: Canada is affordable and welcoming to international students. Known for safe campuses, high living standards, and generous work permits.

countries.name: Australia
countries.popular: Melbourne, Sydney, ANU ‚Äî world-class universities and vibrant student life.
countries.info: Australia combines top universities with a high quality of life. Offers post-study work visas and is a hub for research in the Asia-Pacific.

countries.name: Germany
countries.popular: TUM, Heidelberg, Berlin ‚Äî affordable tuition and excellence in engineering and sciences.
countries.info: Germany offers tuition-free or low-cost education, especially strong in engineering and sciences. Many programs are taught in English.

countries.name: Netherlands
countries.popular: Delft, Amsterdam, Eindhoven ‚Äî innovative programs taught in English with global exposure.
countries.info: The Netherlands provides innovative, English-taught programs, strong in design and engineering, and is popular for its multicultural environment.
